dt: {bc}to bring to an end especially in a particular way or with a particular action
{bc}to reach as a logically necessary end by reasoning {bc}infer on the basis of evidence

dt.t: {wi}concluded{/wi} he would wait a little longer

pt: {sc}close{/sc} {sc}end{/sc} {sc}conclude{/sc} {sc}finish{/sc} {sc}complete{/sc} {sc}terminate{/sc} mean to bring or come to a stopping point or limit. {sc}close{/sc} usually implies that something has been in some way open as well as unfinished.
{sc}end{/sc} conveys a strong sense of finality.
{sc}conclude{/sc} may imply a formal closing (as of a meeting).
{sc}finish{/sc} may stress completion of a final step in a process.

pt.t: after it is painted, the house will be {it}finished{/it}

pt: {sc}complete{/sc} implies the removal of all deficiencies or a successful finishing of what has been undertaken.

pt.t: the resolving of this last issue {it}completes{/it} the agreement

pt: {sc}terminate{/sc} implies the setting of a limit in time or space.

{sc}infer{/sc} {sc}deduce{/sc} {sc}conclude{/sc} {sc}judge{/sc} {sc}gather{/sc} mean to arrive at a mental conclusion. {sc}infer{/sc} implies arriving at a conclusion by reasoning from evidence; if the evidence is slight, the term comes close to {it}surmise{/it}.

pt.t: from that remark, I {it}inferred{/it} that they knew each other

pt: {sc}deduce{/sc} often adds to {sc}infer{/sc} the special implication of drawing a particular inference from a generalization.

pt.t: denied we could {it}deduce{/it} anything important from human mortality

pt: {sc}conclude{/sc} implies arriving at a necessary inference at the end of a chain of reasoning.

pt.t: {it}concluded{/it} that only the accused could be guilty

pt: {sc}judge{/sc} stresses a weighing of the evidence on which a conclusion is based.
{sc}gather{/sc} suggests an intuitive forming of a conclusion from implications.

pt.t: {it}gathered{/it} their desire to be alone without a word

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}concludere{/it} to shut up, end, infer, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}claudere{/it} to shut {ma}{mat|close:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to bring to an end especially in a particular way or with a particular action
to reach as a logically necessary end by reasoning : infer on the basis of evidence
to make a decision about : decide
